HousePricePrediction package

Submodules

HousePricePrediction.ingest_data module

HousePricePrediction.ingest_data.fetch_housing_data(housing_url, housing_path, logger)

Fetch and extract housing data.

Downloads the housing data from the provided URL, extracts it, and saves it into the specified directory.

housing_urlstr

URL to download the housing data from.

housing_pathstr

Directory path to save the downloaded and extracted data.

loggerlogging.Logger

Logger instance for logging the process.

None

HousePricePrediction.ingest_data.load_housing_data(housing_path)

Load housing data from the specified directory.

housing_pathstr

Directory path to load the housing data from.

pd.DataFrame

DataFrame containing the housing data.

HousePricePrediction.ingest_data.main(args)

Main function to ingest housing data.

This function handles the data ingestion process including downloading, extracting, loading, processing the housing data, and saving the processed data.

argsargparse.Namespace

The command-line arguments passed to the script.

None

HousePricePrediction.logger module

HousePricePrediction.logger.get_logger(name, log_file=None, log_level='INFO', no_console_log=False)

Create and configure a logger.

This function creates a logger with the specified name and log level. It can log to a file, the console, or both. The format for logging is: timestamp - logger name - log level - message.

namestr

The name of the logger.

log_filestr, optional

The file path to log to. If None, file logging is disabled. Default is None.

log_levelstr, optional

The log level for the logger. Default is “INFO”. Acceptable values are “DEBUG”, “INFO”,”WARNING”, “ERROR”, “CRITICAL”.

no_console_logbool, optional

If True, disables logging to the console. Default is False.

logging.Logger

Configured logger instance.

HousePricePrediction.score module

HousePricePrediction.score.load_housing_data(processed_data_path)

Load housing data from a specified directory.

processed_data_pathstr

The path to the directory containing the processed housing data.

pd.DataFrame

A DataFrame containing the housing data.

HousePricePrediction.score.main(args)

Main function to execute the scoring process.

This function loads the housing data, splits it into training and testing sets, preprocesses the data, loads pre-trained models, makes predictions, and evaluates the models using RMSE and MAE.

argsargparse.Namespace

The command-line arguments passed to the script.

HousePricePrediction.train module

HousePricePrediction.train.load_housing_data(processed_data_path)

Load housing data from the specified directory.

processed_data_pathstr

Directory path to load the processed housing data from.

pd.DataFrame

DataFrame containing the housing data.

HousePricePrediction.train.main(args)

Main function to train machine learning models on housing data.

This function handles the data loading, processing, training of different models, hyperparameter tuning, and saving the trained models.

argsargparse.Namespace

The command-line arguments passed to the script.

None
